oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Handwritten letter to “the Hon. County Court of Davidson Co. Term,” from B.G. Wood, Proprietor of the Phoenix Foundry, Nashville, Tennessee, 1884 July 8th
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A handwritten letter to the Honorable County Court of Davidson County, Tennessee from the Nashville businessman B.G. Wood, Proprietor of Phoenix Foundry. He petitions the committee in regards to tax assessments for the years 1882 and 1883. He cites the name of Assessor Mr. John Hess? Of the 1st Ward and refers in a postscript that “it’s well known of my great losses both of Flood & Fire without going into detail.” Forms part of the Davidson County Court, Loose Records-Additions-Wards. 1 letter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wood, B.G.
Phoenix Foundry (Nashville, Tenn.)
